newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-FileNet cut by Brean Murray.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-FileNet cut by Brean Murray.

text.p: FileNet Corp was cut to market perform from accumulate by Brean Murray analyst Gordon McCount, who said he "detected a distinct slack in the business over the second quarter" after talking to vendors and integrators.
-- Stock was up 9/16 o 16-3/4 in early trading.
-- Said has concerns about slope of company's recovery from first quarter sales trough.
-- Cut 1997 and 1998 revenue estimates, resulting in lower EPS forecasts. 1997 EPS cut to a loss of a $0.60 from a prior estimate of a loss of $0.26. 1998 EPS cut to $0.86 from $1.05.

-- said key issues are in regard to client/server versus Internet/intranet architectures and Year 2000 concerns diverting attention and dollars from enterprise solutions plus a "shortage of capable I.T. people".
-- also noted P/E, with stock trading at 19 times Brean's revised estimate for 1998 EPS of $0.86 a share.
